required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CAR-T Cells in Treating Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Uncontrolled, Multicenter Clinical Trial to Explore the Safety, Efficacy, and Remission Phase of Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell (CAR-T) in the Treatment of Relapsed Refractory (R/R) Multiple Myeloma (MM)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is aimed to evaluate the safety, feasibility and efficacy of CAR-T cell therapy in the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a study to evaluate the safety, feasibility and efficacy of CAR-T cell therapy in the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.
The Main research objectives:
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of CAR-T cell therapy in patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.
The Secondary research objectives:
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of CAR-T cell therapy in patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Severe/Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Severe/Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety
Copies numbers of CAR in peripheral blood(PB) and/or bone marrow(BM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate of complete remission and partial remission
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate of complete remission and partial remission

arm_group.description: The patient voluntarily signs the informed consent, and the patient meets the entry criteria to diagnose patients with Relapsed Refractory (R/R) Multiple Myeloma (MM)

intervention.description: Volunteers will be treated with BCMA CAR-T cells

overall_official.affiliation: The Second Hospital of Hebei Medical University

facility.name: the Second Hospital of HeBei Medical University (HBMU)
